business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open flat as markets consolidate before key Q2 resultsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 123.01 points to 83,855.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 53.50 points to 25,710.05 as of 9:33 am.

Amazon, OpenAI sign massive $38 billion deal for Nvidia chipsUnder the deal, AWS will provide OpenAI with access to hundreds of thousands of Nvidia graphics processing units (GPUs), including the latest GB200 and GB300 AI accelerators.

Groww IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check GMPThe Rs 6,632.30 crore Groww IPO opens for bidding on November 4 and will close on November 7, 2025. The issue includes a fresh issue worth Rs 1,060 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of Rs 5,572.30 crore.

ED has attached assets under PMLA, Anil Ambani not on board: Reliance InfraThe clarification follows the ED's latest attachment of over 132 acres of land at Dhirubhai Ambani Knowledge City in Navi Mumbai, worth Rs 4,462 crore, in a bank fraud case involving Reliance Communications and related firms.

Adani Power, Bangladesh opt for arbitration to settle payment dispute: ReportAdani Power stressed that it continues to meet its contractual obligation to supply electricity to Bangladesh and is receiving regular payments to the extent acknowledged by Bangladesh Power Development Board.

Luxury in 2026: Why financial peace is the ultimate status symbol, explains CALuxury isn't loud any more. In 2026, it's quiet, calm, and deeply personal. As one CA puts it, the ultimate status symbol is not a luxury car or a holiday abroad — it's the peace that comes from financial stability.

Sensex, Nifty take a breather after October's strong rally as markets end flatThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 39.78 points to close at 83,978.49, while the NSE Nifty50 added 41.25 points to end at 25,763.35.

Lenskart vs Groww: Which IPO offers better value for investors? Lenskart offers exposure to India's growing eyewear market backed by a strong offline and online presence, while Groww provides access to the country's booming retail investment ecosystem.

Personal loan vs credit card EMI: Which option saves you more money?Managing expenses through instalments can be convenient, but it's important to know what you're signing up for. Should you go for a personal loan or a credit card EMI when you need quick funds? Let's find out which one benefits your pocket more.

Renting vs buying? The real question is liquidity vs liability, says expertIs it smarter to rent or buy a home? An expert says that's not the question to ask. He believes the real issue lies in whether you're building liquidity or adding liability through your financial choices.

Looking for steady returns? Check who's giving up to 7.65% on 3-year FDsIf you're aiming for safe yet rewarding investments, 3-year fixed deposits are worth a look. Several banks are offering interest rates of up to 7.65%, giving savers a solid balance of security and returns.

EPFO launches Employee Enrolment Scheme 2025: How it benefits workersIn a move to strengthen the formal workforce, the government has rolled out the Employee Enrolment Scheme 2025 under the EPFO. The scheme aims to benefit workers by ensuring PF coverage and long-term financial security.

Amid Tata Trusts row, Ratan Tata's sisters recall his unwavering judgementRatan Tata died on October 9, 2024, at the age of 86. Though he never married, he maintained close relationships with his siblings, brother Jimmy Tata, half-brother Noel Tata, and half-sisters Shireen and Deanna Jejeebhoy.

India triples rare earth magnet investment to cut China reliance: ReportThe new plan represents a major step up from the earlier $290 million initiative, which was focused on ensuring supplies of essential materials for electric vehicles, renewable energy, and defence sectors.

Mehli Mistry sets stage for legal battle after removal from Tata Trusts boardMehli Mistry's caveat sets up a hearing where questions of process, past resolutions, and trust deed interpretation will decide if the non-renewal stands or triggers a deeper inquiry in the coming weeks.

Why India needs a low-tariff trade deal with the US nowA trade pact with the US can expand exports and create millions of jobs, but only if India tackles agriculture and labour reforms. The opportunity is real, and the moment demands resolve.
Sensex, Nifty open in red as private lenders pull markets downThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 252.57 points to 83,686.14, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 50.40 points to 25,671.70 as of 9:28 am.

Gold prices drop again: What's dragging precious metal rates downOn the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) in India, gold futures maturing on December 5, 2025, were trading at Rs 1,21,284 per 10 grams, down by Rs 224 or 0.18%.

Mid-segment housing: Is it the real core of India's property boom?After years of luxury-led projects, India's real estate developers are refocusing on the mid-segment — a market driven by young professionals, dual-income families, and first-time buyers. But is this segment truly the backbone of India's property boom?

The 'missing' Indian-origin CEO behind Rs 4,200 crore BlackRock loan fraudBankim Brahmbhatt, the Indian-origin CEO of a US-based telecom company, is facing a lawsuit in the US filed by HPS, the private credit investment arm of BlackRock.

entertainment.headline: Madhuri Dixit arrives 3 hours late at Canada event, fans allege mismanagement Bollywood actor Madhuri Dixit faced criticism after arriving about three hours late to a Canada event, with attendees alleging mismanagement and raising concerns over the event's organisation.

Kannada-Telugu TV actor harassed online, accused arrested A Kannada and Telugu television actor has filed a complaint with the police after enduring three months of online harassment, leading to the arrest of the accused.

Dakota Johnson is dating again after breakup with Chris Martin. Report After ending her eight-year relationship with Chris Martin in June 2025, Dakota Johnson is gradually returning to dating while prioritising self-fulfillment, career, and friendships.

Rashmika flexes 'important' ring amid engagement rumours with Vijay Deverakonda Rashmika Mandanna's appearance on Jagapathi Babu's talk show 'Jayammu Nischayammu Raa' sparks conversation as she displays her engagement ring, fuelling discussion around her recent engagement to Vijay Deverakonda. The episode features candid interactions and reactions that have caught the audience's attention.

Shehnaaz gets emotional as contestant sings Teri Meri on India's Got Talent. Watch Actor Shehnaaz Gill recently broke down on 'India's Got Talent' after a contestant sang 'Teri Meri' song from the film 'Bodyguard'. Fans remembered Sidharth Shukla.

Salman Khan goes shirtless in new pics, fans declare 'Tiger zinda hain' Salman Khan's recent shirtless photos, accompanied by a philosophical caption, prompt discussion among fans and followers about his fitness and the message behind his words. He will be seen next in 'Battle of Galwan'.

Golden Bachelor Gerry Turner Opens Up About Mental Health Struggles Gerry Turner, known for leading the first season of 'The Golden Bachelor', has addressed his experiences with severe mental health challenges following his public separation from Theresa Nist.

Dhurandhar to Avatar 3: Inside India's 2025-end slate and box office pulse As 2025 enters its final stretch, Bollywood finds its rhythm again while the South holds steady with grounded storytelling. Trade experts break down what worked, what didn't, and what lies ahead as the year ends.

HYBE India says namaste as it debuts official social media accounts Korean entertainment company HYBE, known for managing groups like BTS and SEVENTEEN, announced its arrival in India with the launch of official social media channels, signaling a strategic expansion into the country's entertainment industry.

Oscar-nominated actor Diane Ladd dies at 89, daughter Laura Dern confirms Diane Ladd, a three-time Academy Award nominee recognised for her roles in 'Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore' and 'Wild at Heart', has died at 89. Her daughter, Laura Dern, confirmed her death on Monday.

Bigg Boss 19 day 71: Ashnoor comforts Abhishek after emotional talk about love The latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19' saw Abhishek Bajaj tearing up after an emotional talk about love with co-contestant Ashnoor Kaur. Later, Amaal Mallik and Malti Chahar engaged in an argument over how long they had known each other.

Baramulla producer on changing face of Indian storytelling: One cinema, one country 'Baramulla' producer Lokesh Dhar said Indian cinema is entering an era of unity and authenticity. In an exclusive conversation, he said filmmakers are blending regional stories with rich folklore to engage a discerning audience.

Kantara kind of film working is a good thing: Baramulla director Aditya Jambhale Director Aditya Suhas Jambhale emphasised the need for originality and conviction in Indian cinema. He believes strong writing and risk-taking can push the industry beyond formulaic trends.

Actor Thanja Vuur praises India, slams South Africa for ignoring women's cricket South African actor Thanja Vuur has criticised her country's cricket legends and fans for ignoring the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 final. She contrasted it with the strong support shown by Indians for their own team.

Sonakshi recalls Zaheer asking if she wanted to live apart from her in-laws Sonakshi Sinha recently opened up about her decision to live with her in-laws after her marriage to Zaheer Iqbal. She also shared insights into her married life and her close bond with the family.

Milind Soman's thrilling pre-birthday bash: Diving in Maldives Actor Milind Soman offered a look at his pre-birthday celebrations in the Maldives on Monday. His latest social media post featured underwater exploration alongside his wife, Ankita Konwar.

Anthony Hopkins rejects autism claims by wife, calls mental health labels nonsense Actor Anthony Hopkins has dismissed suggestions of autism raised by his wife. He described mental health labels as nonsense and embraces the complexity of being human.

Anupam Kher gets emotional over tribute from Satish Kaushik's daughter. Video Anupam Kher got emotional after receiving a heartfelt tribute from his late friend Satish Kaushik's daughter, Vanshika, thanking her for her loving words. The actor shared that Satish would be proud, adding that he will always be there for Vanshika as a guiding presence.

Prakash Raj criticises National Awards, says they don't deserve Mammootty Kerala State Film Awards chairperson and actor Prakash Raj on Monday expressed concerns regarding Mammootty's lack of national recognition. He questioned the integrity of the National Awards process.

general news.headline: Ashwin praises Harmanpreet-led India for honouring legends: Men's team never did itRavichandran Ashwin's bold words hit home after India's historic win. The off-spinner praised Harmanpreet Kaur's side for doing what, in his view, the men's team never did, sharing their glory with past legends.

3 men shot by cops, arrested over gang-rape of student near Coimbatore airportThe gang rape of the college student near Coimbatore airport has sent shockwaves across the state, sparking widespread political outrage. Several parties have demanded stringent action against the accused.

Indian-origin trucker who killed 3 in California crash was not drunk: AuthoritiesUS authorities say Indian-origin driver Jashanpreet Singh wasn't intoxicated during a California crash that killed three people, but he still faces grossly negligent homicide and reckless driving charges.

Delhi's air quality stays in very poor category for third consecutive dayA persistent haze continued to affect Delhi as the city's air quality stayed in the 'very poor' category for the third straight day. Pollution levels have remained high since Diwali due to low wind speeds and cooler temperatures.

Cameras analysing my every move: Erika Kirk breaks silence after JD Vance momentErika Kirk, widow of Turning Point USA founder Charlie Kirk, broke her silence after a viral JD Vance moment, urging transparency and cameras in the murder trial of her husband's accused killer.

Live: Tejashwi Yadav promises free electricity, increase MSP for farmers in BiharBihar Election 2025 News Live: Today marks the last day of campaigning for the first phase of the Bihar Assembly elections, covering 121 constituencies. Campaigning will conclude at 5 pm. Voting for this phase is scheduled for November 6 across 18 districts. Monday witnessed high-voltage campaign rallies by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Union Home Minister Amit Shah, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge and party general secretary Priyanka Vadra. In this cycle, PM Modi conducted 8 election meetings, with one roadshow in Patna. Today, he will interact with women workers of the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance. Stay with indiatoday.in for the latest updates.

Better a Democrat than a Communist: Trump backs Andrew Cuomo for NYC MayorPresident Donald Trump warned he'll restrict federal funds to New York City if Democrat Zohran Mamdani wins Tuesday's mayoral race, calling him a "Communist" and backing Andrew Cuomo instead.

Yunus govt bows to Islamists, drops plan to hire music, physical education teachersUnder mounting pressure from hardline Islamic clerics, the interim government of Muhammad Yunus has scrapped its plans to hire music and physical education teachers for government-run primary schools. Calling the move "un-Islamic, forced and irrelevant", the Islamists had threatened to take to the streets if their demand was not met.

Haryana man shoots teen after allegedly stalking her, both went to same libraryThe incident took place outside a private library in Faridabad that both the girl and the accused regularly attended for study sessions, and was recorded on CCTV.

Vreels: A Game-Changing Platform Pushing Social Media Beyond TikTok and InstagramVreels isn't just about sharing, it's about connecting meaningfully. Through built-in chat, voice, and video call features, users can communicate without leaving the app.

US bars 7,000 truckers for failing English tests; Indian-origin drivers hit hardOver 7,000 US truck drivers have been placed out of service this year for failing English proficiency tests, Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said. Thousands of them are believed to be of Indian-origin truckers, mostly from Punjab and Haryana. Around 1,50,000 Sikhs work in the US trucking industry.

3 in 4 Indian student visa applications to Canada rejected in August: ReportFigures from Canada's immigration department show that about 74% of Indian applicants were denied study permits in August 2025, compared to 32% in August 2023.

Harmanpreet should hand over India captaincy to Mandhana: Shantha RangaswamyA day after India's historic Women's ODI World Cup triumph, former India captain Shantha Rangaswamy has called for a bold leadership change, urging Harmanpreet Kaur to pass the baton to Smriti Mandhana.

I am broken: Air India crash's sole survivor seeks welfare aid to cope with traumaVishwas Kumar Ramesh, the only survivor of the June 12 Air India crash that killed 261 people, has appealed for a welfare package to help him recover from severe physical and psychological trauma.

Pakistan Army a corrupt mercenary mafia trading loyalty for dollars: Sindhi leaderSindhi leader Shafi Burfat accused Pakistan's Army of being a corrupt mercenary mafia that trades loyalty for money, deceives allies, and undermines global trust for financial gain.

Barack Obama refuses to endorse Zohran Mamdani for NYC mayoral electionFormer President Barack Obama declined to endorse New York City mayoral frontrunner Zohran Mamdani despite a recent phone call, maintaining his silence amid a high-stakes election.

SIR 2.0 begins in 12 states and Union Territories, to cover 51 crore votersThe Election Commission has initiated the second phase of its Special Intensive Revision (SIR) across nine states and three Union Territories, aiming to update voter lists and verify the eligibility of around 51 crore electors.

Elon Musk endorses Cuomo in NYC mayoral polls, takes 'Mumdumi' swipe at ZohranElon Musk backs Andrew Cuomo in NYC's mayoral race, opposing Zohran Mamdani's progressive agenda. His endorsement adds billionaire weight to a fiercely polarised contest shaping the city's political future.

Migraine, stroke: Delhi-NCR's toxic air is a threat to your brainDelhi's air pollution has reached hazardous levels, impacting brain health. This silent crisis could accelerate neurological diseases and cognitive decline. Simple symptoms like headaches and brain fog are frequently being reported at hospitals and clinics.

Jaipur trucker had argument with car driver minutes before deadly crash: CopsPolice said the drunk Jaipur truck driver, who killed 19 people and injured dozens, had argued with a car driver minutes before the crash, and enraged by the altercation, went on a reckless rampage.

Who is Neal Katyal? Indian-American lawyer taking on Trump's tariff at Supreme CourtIndian-American lawyer Neal Katyal will argue before the Supreme Court in a historic case testing Donald Trump's power to impose tariffs under emergency law — a decision Trump calls nation-defining.

Zubeen Garg murdered, charge-sheet to be filed by Dec 8: Himanta SarmaThe celebrated singer died under mysterious circumstances while swimming in the sea in Singapore on September 19. He had gone to the Southeast Asian nation to attend the 4th edition of the North East India Festival (NEIF).

sports.headline: South Africa aim fearless new era amid baptism of fire after World Cup loss South Africa may have lost the Women's World Cup final to India on Sunday in Navi Mumbai, but the Proteas appear destined for an era where winning titles consistently is only a matter of time.

Haramnpreet's catch to Devine's farewell: Iconic moments from Women's World Cup Women's World Cup: We look at some of the iconic moments that captured the hearts of fans, including Harmanpreet Kaur's title-winning catch to dismiss Nadine de Klerk against South Africa in Navi Mumbai.

Watch: Harmanpreet Kaur's emotional celebration with father after World Cup wait ends Women's World Cup: A video of Harmanpreet Kaur celebrating India's World Cup triumph with her father, Harmander Singh Bhullar, went viral on social media. On Sunday, India lifted the trophy with a 52-run victory over South Africa at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

A big night: India legends celebrate historic Women's World Cup triumph Women's World Cup 2025: In an interview, Mithali Raj, Diana Edulji, Poonam Yadav and Sushma Verma shared their views on India's victory on Sunday against South Africa at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Kolkata Premier League under scanner after match-fixing probe The Kolkata Premier League has come under the scanner after two club officials from a team in the competition was caught over alleged match-fixing on Monday, November 3.

Sports not for boys anymore: Sania Mirza after India win Women's World Cup Women's World Cup: Former Indian tennis star Sania Mirza heaped praise on the Indian women's team and congratulated them after their win over South Africa in the final on Sunday at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

India's '83 Moment: Women's Team Shatters Glass Ceiling With Historic World Cup Win! This special report unpacks the Indian women's cricket team's historic World Cup victory, featuring insights from legends Mithali Raj and Diana Edulji, captain Harmanpreet Kaur, and other stars. Esteemed journalist Sharda Ugra calls the BCCI's equal pay policy 'a bit of a smoke and mirrors according to me'. The discussion delves into whether this triumph is women's cricket's '1983 moment', the transformative impact of the Women's Premier League (WPL), and the long struggles faced by pioneers like Edulji, who travelled in unreserved train compartments. The panel celebrates the emergence of new heroes and reflects on how the team's self-belief and the BCCI's support system culminated in this groundbreaking championship win that has ignited the dreams of a billion.

'This Feels Personal': Sania Mirza on Indian Women's Historic World Cup Win This special report focuses on the Indian women's cricket team's historic World Cup victory, with tennis icon Sania Mirza sharing her perspective on the monumental achievement. In a message to the champions, Sania Mirza said, 'But as a fellow female athlete, this feels personal and thank you for doing this for us and for our country.' The four-time Olympian and Grand Slam winner discusses the personal pride she feels, drawing parallels with her own journey of breaking barriers in Indian sports. The conversation also explores how the team's success, led by captain Harmanpreet Kaur, will shift mentalities, encourage parental support for female athletes, and inspire a new generation of girls to take up sports, just as athletes like Smriti Mandhana, PV Sindhu, and Mary Kom have.

Jemimah's trolls slammed by veteran India pacer: She is god's favourite child India veteran pacer Shikha Pandey defended Jemimah Rodrigues against trolls following the Women's World Cup 2025 win. Jemimah played a big role in India's Women's World Cup win.

Jemimah's trolls slammed by veteran India pacer: She is god's favourite child India veteran pacer Shikha Pandey defended Jemimah Rodrigues against trolls following the Women's World Cup 2025 win. Jemimah played a big role in India's Women's World Cup win.

Women's World Cup: How team India played the social media gameAfter being trolled not so long ago, Jemimah Rodrigues now stands as the most celebrated face of the Indian team on social media, following their Women's World Cup 2025 win. Apart from Jemimah, the other members of the team gained followers after the historic win.

Nari Shakti Reigns Supreme! India's Women Clinch Historic First-Ever World Cup TitleThis special report focuses on the Indian women's cricket team's historic, first-ever World Cup victory, led by captain Harmanpreet Kaur, after defeating South Africa in a thrilling final. Legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar stated, 'This is a victory for the ages — one that will rank among the greatest in Indian cricket history.' The bulletin covers the team's incredible journey, overcoming past heartbreaks and a challenging path to the finals, including a key semi-final win against Australia. The historic achievement has been met with nationwide celebration and significant financial rewards, including a ₹51 crore prize from the BCCI and gifts from industrialists, marking a pivotal moment for women's cricket in India.

Harmanpreet's 'Smile & Enjoy' Mantra That Led India to World Cup GloryThis special report focuses on the Indian women's cricket team's historic World Cup victory, with insights from captain Harmanpreet Kaur and spinner Radha Yadav. Radha Yadav revealed the captain's simple yet powerful message ahead of the final: 'She just said smile, enjoy. Itna hard work kiya hai. Bas ek final push aur bindas ho ke khelo (You have worked so hard. Just one final push and play freely)'. The conversation highlights the team's calm and composed mindset, which was forged through previous setbacks. Yadav explains that having failed in three matches before, the team had gained the crucial experience of how to stage a comeback, which they executed perfectly to lift the coveted trophy.

MS Dhoni attitude: How Jemimah Rodrigues became a Women's World Cup winnerJemimah Rodrigues' parents revealed how keeping an MS Dhoni attitude helped the 25-year-old progress in cricket and become a World Cup winner. Jemimah played a crucial role in India's Women's World Cup win.

Jemimah's Tears To Triumph: From Anxiety & Being Dropped To World Cup GloryThis special report focuses on Indian cricketer Jemimah Rodrigues and the women's team's historic World Cup victory. Rodrigues reflects on her personal struggles, including being dropped from the team and battling anxiety, which she revealed made her 'cry every single day' during the tournament. The report highlights her crucial, match-winning knock in the semi-final against Australia, which she felt was 'all scripted by someone above'. It delves into her emotional post-match comments about the team's resilience, where she emphasised that they looked out for each other through ups and downs, proving they are a 'real champion team'.

Sports can sometimes be cruel: K Annamalai praises South Africa for spirited World Cup runBJP Tamil Nadu vice-president K. Annamalai lauded South Africa for their resilience and spirit in the ICC Women's World Cup, calling their journey to the final a champion's fight. He also praised skipper Laura Wolvaardt for her record-breaking run.

Harmanpreet Kaur does an MS Dhoni, poses with World Cup at Gateway of IndiaIndia women's team captain Harmanpreet Kaur recreated MS Dhoni's iconic World Cup trophy pose at the Gateway of India on Monday, November 3. Harmanpreet masterminded India's maiden Women's World Cup triumph on Sunday.

Kranti Gaud, Renuka Singh rewarded: India pacers to get Rs 1 crore cash prize eachHimachal's Renuka Singh Thakur and Madhya Pradesh's Kranti Gaud were each awarded Rs 1 crore by their state governments for their vital roles in India's historic 2025 ICC Women's World Cup triumph.

Kranti Gaud, Renuka Singh rewarded: India pacers to get Rs 1 crore cash prize eachHimachal's Renuka Singh Thakur and Madhya Pradesh's Kranti Gaud were each awarded Rs 1 crore by their state governments for their vital roles in India's historic 2025 ICC Women's World Cup triumph.

Delhi Runs in Killer Smog: 'Nothing Short of Stupidity,' Warns ExpertThis special report focuses on the extreme health risks of outdoor exercise in Delhi's severe air pollution, with insights from medical expert and marathon runner, Dr. Agni Kumar. He stated that holding mass running events in these conditions is 'nothing sort of short of stupidity to be holding such mass marathons.' Dr. Kumar explains that while exercising, a person's air intake can increase from 5-6 litres per minute to as high as 100 litres, exponentially increasing the volume of toxic smog inhaled. This, he warns, is equivalent to smoking a vast number of cigarettes and significantly raises the risk of chronic lung diseases like COPD, emphysema, and asthma. The discussion also touches upon why people, influenced by herd mentality, continue to run and cycle in AQI levels of 400, sometimes in government-organised events.

India was so tired of losing that a win was only option left: Deepti Sharma's brotherIndia all-rounder Deepti Sharma's brother Avlesh Sharma reflected on the team's Women's World Cup 2025 triumph. Deepti Sharma was adjudged Player of the Tournament with 215 runs and 22 wickets.

No more losing close games, we were determined this time: Amanjot on World Cup gloryWomen's World Cup, IND vs SA: Amanjot Kaur said that India were determined to go past the finish line in the final against South Africa after losing a few close games in the league stage.

Having failed earlier, India knew how to stay calm in World Cup final: Radha YadavWomen's World Cup 2025: In an interview, Radha Yadav said that India knew how to stay calm in the final, learning from their three losses on the trot against Australia, South Africa and England in the league stage.

Women willed, India won: World Cup's Bella Ciao momentAt the stroke of midnight on November 3, India's women didn't just win a World Cup – they sparked a revolution. After years of toil for recognition, Harmanpreet Kaur and her team fulfilled a dream that started in the 1970s and have started to make the younger generations dream of wearing India's famous blue jersey with pride.

AUS vs IND: Travis Head to miss last 2 T20Is for Ashes preparationsAustralia batter Travis Head has withdrawn from the final two T20Is against India to rejoin South Australia in the Sheffield Shield, aiming to recalibrate his red-ball game ahead of the Ashes. The five-match T20I series between India and Australia is levelled 1-1 after four games.

Indian Heaven Premier League organisers dupe players, officials and flee KashmirThe Indian Heaven Premier League, a private cricket league being played in Srinagar, has found itself in the midst of controversy after the organisers fled from the city after duping the players and officials and with a trail of unpaid bills.

Jemimah on India's journey in World Cup: We had each other's shoulders to cry onWomen's World Cup 2025: In an exclusive interview, Jemimah Rodrigues said how the Indian players supported each other when the team was going through a rough patch, losing three matches on the bounce in the mega event at home.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
